heic.title: HEIC to JPG/PNG
heic.description: Convert iPhone HEIC photos to JPG, PNG
heic.pageTitle: HEIC to JPG Converter - Free Online HEIC Converter
heic.pageDescription: Convert HEIC photos to JPG, PNG for free. No installation required. 100% browser-based, your files never leave your device.
heic.seoKeywords: heic to jpg, heic converter, heic to png, convert heic to jpg, iphone photo converter, heif to jpg, free heic converter, online heic converter, heic to jpg free, heic file converter
heic.whatIsDesc: HEIC (High Efficiency Image Container) is an image format introduced by Apple starting from iOS 11. It provides more efficient compression than JPEG, resulting in about 50% smaller file sizes at the same quality. However, Windows and some older software cannot open HEIC files, requiring conversion to JPG or PNG.
heic.whyConvertDesc: Here are common situations where you need to convert HEIC files:
heic.whyConvertReason1: When you transfer iPhone photos to a Windows PC and cannot open them
heic.whyConvertReason2: When uploading photos to websites or SNS that don't support HEIC
heic.whyConvertReason3: When editing photos in Photoshop or other image editing software
heic.whyConvertReason4: When attaching images to emails for compatibility with recipients
heic.howToUse: How to Convert HEIC to JPG
heic.step1: Drag your HEIC files to the upload area or click to select.
heic.step2: Choose output format - JPG for smaller files, PNG for transparency support.
heic.step3: Adjust the quality slider to balance file size and image quality.
heic.step4: Click 'Convert' and download the converted images.
heic.feature1: Batch conversion - Convert multiple HEIC files at once
heic.feature2: 100% Privacy - Files never leave your device
heic.feature3: Fast processing - Convert instantly in your browser
heic.feature4: High quality - Original image quality preserved
heic.faq1Q: Why can't I open HEIC files on Windows?
heic.faq1A: HEIC is Apple's proprietary format. Windows doesn't natively support it. You can either install a codec from the Microsoft Store or convert to JPG/PNG using this tool.
heic.faq2Q: Is there a file size limit?
heic.faq2A: No server limits since all processing happens in your browser. You can convert files of any size, though very large files may take longer depending on your device.
heic.faq3Q: Will converting HEIC to JPG reduce quality?
heic.faq3A: JPG is a lossy format, so there will be slight quality loss. Use the quality slider to find the best balance, or choose PNG for lossless conversion.
heic.error: Error converting HEIC file. Please make sure it's a valid HEIC/HEIF file.

webp.whatIsDesc: WebP is a next-generation image format developed by Google to improve website loading speed. It provides about 25-34% smaller file sizes than JPEG while maintaining similar quality.
webp.whyConvertDesc: Here are common situations where you need to convert WebP files:
webp.whyConvertReason1: When saved web images don't open in Photoshop or other editing software
webp.whyConvertReason2: When you need to edit images in programs that don't support WebP
webp.whyConvertReason3: When uploading to platforms or systems that require JPG/PNG
webp.whyConvertReason4: When creating presentation materials or documents requiring standard image formats
webp.howToUse: How to Convert WebP to JPG
webp.step1: Drag your WebP files to the upload area or click to select.
webp.step2: Choose output format - JPG for smaller files, PNG for transparency.
webp.step4: Click 'Convert' and download your converted images.
webp.feature1: 100% Privacy - Files never leave your device
webp.feature2: Transparency preserved - WebP transparency converted to PNG perfectly
webp.feature3: Fast processing - Convert instantly in browser
webp.feature4: Batch conversion - Convert multiple files at once
webp.faq1Q: Can I convert WebP with transparency to JPG?
webp.faq1A: Yes, but JPG doesn't support transparency. Transparent areas will become white. Choose PNG format to preserve transparency.
webp.faq2Q: Can I convert animated WebP to GIF?
webp.faq2A: This tool converts static WebP images only. Animated WebP files will be converted as static images.
webp.faq3Q: Is there a file size limit?
webp.faq3A: No server limits since all processing happens in your browser. Any file size is supported.

psd.whatIsDesc: PSD (Photoshop Document) is Adobe Photoshop's native file format. PSD files preserve all layer information, masks, channels, and effects, but can only be opened with Photoshop or compatible software. They are commonly used for graphic design, web design, photo editing, and digital art.
psd.whyConvertDesc: Here are common situations where you need to convert PSD files:
psd.whyConvertReason1: When you need to view design files on a computer without Photoshop
psd.whyConvertReason2: When sharing design deliverables with clients or colleagues
psd.whyConvertReason3: When uploading images to websites or social media
psd.whyConvertReason4: When inserting designs into presentations or documents

psd.step3: Adjust the quality slider to set output quality.
psd.step4: Click 'Convert' and download the flattened image from your PSD.

psd.feature2: 100% Privacy - Design files never leave your device
psd.feature3: Fast processing - Convert large PSD files in seconds
psd.feature4: High quality output - Original resolution preserved
psd.faq1Q: Can I extract individual layers from a PSD?
psd.faq1A: Currently, only the flattened/merged image is extracted. Individual layer extraction requires Photoshop or similar software.
psd.faq2Q: Is there a file size limit?
psd.faq2A: No server limits since all processing happens locally. Theoretically no size limit, though very large files (500MB+) may be slower.
psd.faq3Q: Can I convert AI or EPS files too?
psd.faq3A: This tool is specifically for PSD files. For AI/EPS conversion, use Adobe Illustrator or vector conversion tools.

tiff.whatIsDesc: TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) is a format for storing high-quality, lossless images. It's widely used in printing, publishing, medical imaging, and professional photography due to its ability to preserve original quality without compression artifacts.
tiff.whyConvertDesc: Here are common situations where you need to convert TIFF files:
tiff.whyConvertReason1: When you receive high-resolution print files but need web-compatible formats
tiff.whyConvertReason2: When uploading images to websites or social media that don't support TIFF
tiff.whyConvertReason3: When you need to reduce file size while maintaining acceptable quality
tiff.whyConvertReason4: When viewing scanned documents or images on devices that don't support TIFF

tiff.feature3: Fast processing - Efficient conversion even for large files

tiff.faq1Q: Can I convert multi-page TIFF files?
tiff.faq1A: Yes, multi-page TIFF files are supported. Each page can be converted individually.
tiff.faq2Q: Is there a file size limit?
tiff.faq2A: No server limits since all processing happens in your browser. Large high-resolution TIFF files are supported.
tiff.faq3Q: Will quality be lost when converting to JPG?
tiff.faq3A: TIFF is lossless while JPG is lossy, so some quality loss may occur. Use the quality slider to balance file size and quality, or choose PNG for lossless conversion.

svg.whatIsDesc: SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) is an XML-based vector image format that maintains perfect quality regardless of size. It's widely used for logos, icons, UI elements, and illustrations in web design and app development.
svg.whyConvertDesc: Here are common situations where you need to convert SVG to PNG:
svg.whyConvertReason1: When uploading to platforms that don't support SVG format

svg.whyConvertReason4: When sharing graphics with users who can't view SVG files

svg.step2: Choose the output scale (1x, 2x, 3x, or 4x). Higher scales produce larger, higher-resolution images.
svg.step3: Choose output format (PNG recommended to preserve transparency).
svg.step4: Click 'Convert' and download your rasterized image.
svg.scaleGuideDesc: Choose the appropriate scale based on your intended use:
svg.scale1xDesc: 1x - Original size: Web thumbnails, small icons
svg.feature1: Scalable output - Convert at up to 4x resolution
svg.feature2: 100% Privacy - SVG files never leave your device
svg.feature3: Transparency preserved - Perfect for logos and icons
svg.feature4: Fast processing - Instant conversion in browser
svg.faq1Q: How do I choose the right scale?
svg.faq1A: For web use, 1x or 2x is sufficient. For print materials, use 3x or 4x. Higher scales produce larger file sizes but better quality for printing.
svg.faq2A: Yes, PNG format preserves SVG transparency perfectly. Choose PNG to maintain transparent areas in your vector graphics.
svg.faq3Q: Are complex SVGs with effects supported?
svg.faq3A: Most standard SVG elements are supported. However, some complex filters or effects may render differently depending on browser capabilities.

compress.title: Reduce Image Size
compress.description: Reduce JPG, PNG, WebP image file size
compress.pageTitle: Reduce Image Size - Free Online Image Compressor
compress.pageDescription: Reduce JPG, PNG, WebP image file size for free. Adjust quality and dimensions for optimization. 100% browser-based and secure.
compress.seoKeywords: image compressor, compress image, reduce image size, jpg compressor, png compressor, webp compressor, image optimizer, free image compressor, online image compressor
compress.whatDesc: Image compression optimizes file size by adjusting quality and dimensions while maintaining acceptable visual quality. It's essential for improving website loading speed, email attachments, social media uploads, and storage optimization.
compress.whyCompressDesc: Here are common situations where image compression is useful:
compress.whyCompressReason1: When optimizing images for website performance and faster loading
compress.whyCompressReason2: When attaching images to emails that have size limits
compress.whyCompressReason3: When uploading photos to social media that may re-compress images
compress.whyCompressReason4: When saving storage space on your device or cloud storage
compress.step1: Drag your image file to the upload area or click to select.
compress.step2: Adjust the quality slider - lower values mean smaller files but reduced quality.
compress.step3: Optionally set maximum width to resize large images.
compress.step4: Choose output format and click 'Compress' to download the optimized image.
compress.qualityGuideDesc: Choose quality settings based on your needs:
compress.quality80Desc: 80-100%: High quality - Minimal visible difference, recommended for photos
compress.quality60Desc: 60-80%: Good balance - Noticeable file size reduction with acceptable quality
compress.quality40Desc: 40-60%: Web optimized - Significant reduction, suitable for thumbnails
compress.quality20Desc: 20-40%: Maximum compression - Visible quality loss, only for small previews
compress.whyResize: Resize Support - Set maximum width to reduce image dimensions
compress.whyFormats: Multiple Formats - Output to JPG, PNG, or WebP
compress.feature1: Real-time preview - See file size reduction before downloading
compress.feature2: 100% Privacy - Images never leave your device
compress.feature3: Dimension resize - Reduce image dimensions along with compression
compress.feature4: Multiple formats - Output as JPG, PNG, or WebP
compress.faq1A: For photos, 70-80% offers a good balance of quality and file size. For web images, 60-70% is often sufficient. Test different settings to find your optimal balance.
compress.faq2Q: Which format gives the smallest file size?
compress.faq2A: WebP typically produces the smallest files (20-30% smaller than JPG), followed by JPG. PNG is lossless and produces larger files but preserves quality perfectly.
compress.faq3Q: Will compression damage my original file?
compress.faq3A: No, the original file is never modified. A new compressed copy is created for download, leaving your original intact.

audio.bitrate256Desc: 256 kbps - High quality, suitable for music
audio.bitrate320Desc: 320 kbps - Maximum MP3 quality, best for audiophiles
audio.feature1: Multiple formats - Convert to MP3, WAV, or OGG
audio.feature2: 100% Privacy - Audio files never leave your device
audio.feature3: Quality control - Choose from multiple bitrate options
audio.feature4: Fast conversion - FFmpeg powered in-browser processing
audio.faq1A: For voice recordings, 128-192 kbps is sufficient. For music, 256-320 kbps provides better quality. Higher bitrates mean larger files.
audio.faq2Q: Is there a file length limit?
audio.faq2A: No server limits since all processing happens in your browser. However, very long audio files may take more time and memory to convert.
audio.faq3Q: Will quality be lost when converting?
audio.faq3A: Converting between lossy formats (M4A to MP3) involves some quality loss. For maximum quality preservation, choose WAV format.

video.whatIsDesc: WebM is a web-optimized video format developed by Google. It's commonly used for browser-based screen recordings, web videos, and YouTube streaming. WebM offers good compression with open-source codecs like VP8 and VP9.
video.whyConvertDesc: Here are common situations where you need to convert WebM files:
video.whyConvertReason1: When editing screen recordings in video software like Premiere or Final Cut
video.whyConvertReason2: When uploading to platforms or devices that don't support WebM format
video.whyConvertReason3: When sharing videos with people whose devices can't play WebM
video.whyConvertReason4: When embedding videos in presentations or documents that require MP4

video.qualityLowDesc: Low - Smallest file size, noticeable quality reduction. Good for quick sharing.

video.faq1A: Conversion time depends on video length and your device's performance. Most videos under 5 minutes convert in under a minute.
video.faq2Q: Is there a file size or length limit?
video.faq2A: No server limits since all processing is local. However, very long videos (30+ minutes) may be slow or run into memory limits depending on your device.
video.faq3A: Yes, audio is fully preserved and converted to AAC format, which is standard for MP4 files.

gif.whatIsDesc: GIF (Graphics Interchange Format) is an image format that supports animation. While universally supported across devices and platforms, GIF uses inefficient compression, resulting in large file sizes for animations.
gif.whyConvertDesc: Here are key reasons to convert GIF to MP4:
gif.whyConvertReason1: Reduce file size by up to 90% while maintaining visual quality
gif.whyConvertReason2: Improve loading speed on websites and social media
gif.whyConvertReason3: Better support for hardware acceleration on mobile devices
gif.whyConvertReason4: More efficient for longer or high-resolution animations
gif.howToUse: How to Convert GIF to MP4
gif.step1: Drag your GIF file to the upload area or click to select.
gif.step2: Preview the animation to verify it's the correct file.
gif.step3: Choose quality level based on your needs.
gif.step4: Click 'Convert' and download your compressed MP4 video.
gif.useCases: When to Use GIF to MP4
gif.useCase1: Website optimization - Faster loading, lower bandwidth
gif.useCase2: Social media - Better playback on Twitter/Instagram
gif.useCase3: Messaging - Smaller files for quick sharing
gif.useCase4: Mobile apps - More efficient on battery and data
gif.feature1: Dramatic compression - Reduce file size by up to 90%
gif.feature2: 100% Privacy - GIF files never leave your device
gif.feature3: Quality preserved - Visually identical to original
gif.feature4: Instant preview - See your GIF before converting
gif.faq1Q: How much smaller will my file be?
gif.faq1A: Typically 70-90% smaller. A 10MB GIF often converts to under 1MB MP4 with similar visual quality.
gif.faq2A: MP4 uses more efficient compression but maintains visual quality. Most people can't tell the difference.
gif.faq3Q: Can I convert MP4 back to GIF?
gif.faq3A: This tool only converts GIF to MP4. Converting back would result in a larger file again.
gif.error: Error converting GIF. Please check the file format.

split.whySplitReason1: When extracting specific chapters or sections from a large document

split.faq1A: Use commas to separate ranges and dashes for sequences. Example: '1-3, 5, 7-10' extracts pages 1-3, page 5, and pages 7-10.

split.faq2A: Yes, there's no limit on the number of splits. The 'By Page' mode creates one file per page.
split.faq3Q: What happens to the original file?

compress.title: Reduce PDF Size
compress.pageTitle: Reduce PDF Size - Free Online PDF Compressor
compress.pageDescription: Reduce PDF file size for free. Adjust image quality for optimal file size. 100% browser-based and secure.
compress.seoKeywords: compress pdf, reduce pdf size, pdf compressor, shrink pdf, optimize pdf, free pdf compressor, online pdf compressor, pdf file size reducer
compress.whatIsDesc: PDF compression reduces file size primarily by re-compressing images within the document. Most of a PDF's size comes from embedded images, so optimizing these can dramatically reduce file size while maintaining acceptable visual quality.
compress.whyCompressDesc: Here are common situations where PDF compression is useful:
compress.whyCompressReason1: When PDF exceeds email attachment size limits
compress.whyCompressReason2: When uploading to websites with file size restrictions
compress.whyCompressReason3: When saving storage space on your device
compress.whyCompressReason4: When sharing large documents over slow connections
compress.step1: Drag your PDF file to the upload area or click to select.
compress.step2: Choose compression level - Low for maximum reduction, High for best quality.
compress.step3: For fine control, use 'Custom' and adjust the quality slider.
compress.step4: Click 'Compress PDF' and download your smaller file.
compress.feature1: Adjustable compression - Choose from presets or custom quality
compress.feature2: 100% Privacy - PDF files never leave your device
compress.feature3: Size comparison - See before and after file sizes
compress.feature4: Fast processing - Compress even large PDFs quickly
compress.faq1Q: How much can I reduce file size?
compress.faq1A: Depends on the PDF content. Image-heavy PDFs can be reduced by 60-80%. Text-only PDFs may see minimal reduction as text is already compact.
compress.faq2A: No, only images are compressed. Text, vectors, and fonts remain unchanged and crisp.
compress.faq3Q: Why is my compressed file still large?
compress.faq3A: If the PDF contains mostly text or already-compressed images, there's limited room for reduction. Try a lower quality setting for more compression.

image.whatIsDesc: Image chromakey removes a specific color (usually green or blue) from photos and replaces it with a different background. This technique, also called 'green screen', is widely used in photography and video production to create composite images with custom backgrounds.

image.whyUseReason2: Making professional-looking product photos with clean backgrounds
image.whyUseReason3: Creating profile pictures or ID photos with solid backgrounds
image.whyUseReason4: Making marketing materials and social media graphics
image.step1: Upload your green screen or blue screen photo.
image.step2: Select a background image to composite with.
image.step3: Adjust chromakey color (green/blue) and tolerance settings.
image.step4: Click 'Composite' and download your finished image.
image.feature1: Real-time preview - See results instantly as you adjust
image.feature2: 100% Privacy - Images never leave your device
image.feature3: Fine control - Adjust tolerance and edge smoothing
image.feature4: Multiple formats - Supports JPG, PNG, and WebP
image.faq1Q: Can I use chromakey without a green/blue screen?
image.faq1A: Chromakey works best with solid color backgrounds. For regular photos, try our AI Background Removal tool instead.
image.faq2Q: Why are there green edges around my subject?
image.faq2A: Adjust the 'Tolerance' slider higher to remove more green, or use 'Edge Smoothing' to blend edges better.
image.faq3Q: Can I use transparent PNG images?
image.faq3A: Yes, transparent PNG images can also be used. The transparent areas will automatically composite with the background.
image.error: Error compositing images. Please check if the files are valid images.

video.title: Video Chromakey
video.description: Composite green screen videos with backgrounds
video.pageTitle: Video Chromakey Composite - Free Online Green Screen Video Tool
video.pageDescription: Composite green screen and blue screen videos with background images for free. Processed in your browser for complete privacy.
video.seoKeywords: video chromakey, video green screen, green screen video, blue screen video, video composite, background composite, free video composite, online video composite
video.whatIsDesc: Video chromakey removes a specific background color from videos recorded with green or blue screen backgrounds and composites them with a custom background image. This technique is widely used for YouTube content, live streaming, presentations, and professional video production.
video.whyUseChromakeyDesc: Here are common situations where video chromakey is useful:
video.whyUseReason1: Creating YouTube or TikTok content with custom backgrounds
video.whyUseReason2: Making educational videos with presenter over slides
video.whyUseReason3: Compositing webcam footage over gameplay for streaming
video.whyUseReason4: Creating product demos and promotional videos
video.step1: Upload your green screen or blue screen video.
video.step2: Select a background image to composite with.
video.step3: Adjust chromakey color (green/blue) and tolerance settings.
video.step4: Click 'Composite' to generate your video with the new background.
video.feature1: Real-time preview - See settings take effect immediately
video.feature2: 100% Privacy - Videos never leave your device
video.feature3: Fine control - Adjust tolerance, smoothing, and spill removal
video.feature4: Multiple formats - Supports MP4, WebM, MOV and more
video.faq1Q: Can I use chromakey on videos without a green/blue screen?
video.faq1A: Chromakey works best with solid color backgrounds. For regular videos, professional AI-based background removal may be needed.
video.faq2Q: Is there a video length or file size limit?
video.faq2A: No server limits, but browser memory constraints apply. We recommend videos under 5 minutes for best performance. Split longer videos into segments.
video.faq3Q: Which is better - green screen or blue screen?
video.faq3A: Green screen is most common. Use blue screen if your subject has green clothing or objects.
video.error: Error compositing video. Please check the file format.

faq.q1: Are files sent to a server?
faq.a1: No, all file processing happens only in your browser. Files are never sent to external servers, ensuring complete privacy protection.
faq.q2: Is it free? Are there usage limits?
faq.a2: Completely free. No registration, no file size limits, no daily usage limits. Use as much as you want.
faq.a3: All modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge are supported. For the best experience, we recommend using the latest browser version.
faq.a4: We maintain original quality as much as possible. For images and PDFs, you can adjust quality options to balance file size and quality.
